translated: The Collection of Long Sayings .
The Discourse on Loving-kindness

original: “Karaṇīyamatthakusalena,🔽Yanta santaṁ padaṁ abhisamecca;🔽Sakko ujū ca suhujū ca,
analyzed: karaṇīyam attha kusalena  yanta santam padam abhisamet ca  sakkaḥ ujū ca suhujū ca
translated: “The one skilled in what is beneficial should do🔽This, having fully understood the peaceful state:🔽Be upright and very upright,
Be easy to speak to, gentle, and not proud.
Be content and easy to support,
With few duties and simple living.
Be mindful and discerning,
Not meddlesome, not greedy for families.
Don’t do anything bad even in the slightest,

original: Yena viññū pare upavadeyyuṁ;🔽Sukhino va khemino hontu,
analyzed: yena viññū pare upavadeyyu  sukhinaḥ kheminaḥ hontu
translated: By which others who are discerning would criticize you.🔽May all beings be happy and secure,
May all beings be well and happy.

original: Ye keci pāṇabhūtatthi,🔽Tasā vā thāvarā vanavasesā;
translated: Whatever breathing beings there are,🔽No matter if they are frail or solid,
Long or big,
Medium, short, small, or thick.

analyzed: diṭṭhāḥ vā ye va a diṭṭhā
translated: Seen or unseen,
Those dwelling far or near,
Those who are born or to be born,
May all beings be well and happy.
Let no one deceive another,

analyzed: na atimaññetha katthaci na kañci  byārosanā paṭigha sañña
translated: Nor despise any person whatsoever in any place.
Let him not wish any harm to another🔽Out of anger or resentment.
As a mother would protect with her life

analyzed: āyusā eka puttam anurakkhe  evam pi sabba bhūtesu
translated: her own son, her only son,
so one should cultivate a boundless heart towards all beings.
Let one cultivate a boundless heart towards the entire world
—above, below, and across (likewise)

original: Asambādhaṁ averamasapattaṁ.🔽Tiṭṭhaṁ caraṁ nisinno va,🔽Sayāno yāvatāssa vitamiddho;
analyzed: asambādham  tiṭṭham caram nisinnaḥ va  sa yānaḥ yāvatā assa vitamiddhaḥ
translated: unrestricted, without hatred or enmity.🔽Whether standing, walking, sitting or lying down
as long as one is without sloth,
one should resolve upon mindfulness.🔽This is called the holy life, the supreme austerity.
Not falling into (wrong) views,
virtuous, endowed with insight,
having given up sensual desire,

analyzed: na hi jātuggabbhaseyya punar eti iti
